Introduction
In order to ease and automate Linux installations, &company-suse; offers AutoYaST2. AutoYaST2 lets the user create a configuration for a system to be installed and automatically performs the installation if the configuration is provided to &yast2; during installation.
&IntroductionLinuxJournal;
Using AutoYaST2, multiple systems sharing the same environment and hardware performing similar tasks can easily be installed in parallel. A configuration file (referred to as "control file") is created using existing configuration resources and it can be easily tailored for any specific settings. This chapter will guide you through the three steps of auto-installation:
Auto-installation process &autoyast-oview;
Prepare: All relevant information about the target system is collected and turned into the appropriate directives of the control file. The control file is transferred onto the target system where its directives will be parsed and transformed to &yast2; conforming data.
Install: follows the instructions given in the control file and installs a base system.
Configure: &yast2; and some user-defined post-install scripts accomplish the system configuration
